definition: to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty

sentences.english: Is it a natural disaster, or negligence by our officials?
sentences.chinese: 这是自然灾害，还是我们官员的失职？

sentences.english: It also contained provisions forbidding bribery and official misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 该项法律还规定，禁止行贿受贿和失职渎职行为。

sentences.english: Party B causes great loss to Party A due to its breach of duty and jobbery.
sentences.chinese: 乙方严重失职，营私舞弊，给甲方利益造成重大损失。

sentences.english: Governmental neglect of duty led directly to the destruction of the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 政府部门的失职，直接导致了五湖大酒店的毁灭。

sentences.english: The infectious disease prevents and controls the dereliction of duty crime to belong to in the misconduct offence a concrete charge.
sentences.chinese: 传染病防治失职罪属于渎职罪中的一个具体罪名。

sentences.english: The losses caused by dereliction of duty, in addition to price as compensation, but also have to be disciplined.
sentences.chinese: 对失职造成的亏损，除照价赔偿外，还要给纪律处分。

sentences.english: Before closing, I would be remiss not to mention performance.
sentences.chinese: 在结束之前，如果不提一下性能就是我的失职了。

sentences.english: We will conduct in-depth investigations into cases of dereliction of duty and corruption related to production safety and severely punish the responsible parties.
sentences.chinese: 严肃查处安全生产领域的失职渎职和腐败问题。

sentences.english: The clock from Gao Yishan rage of dereliction of duty.
sentences.chinese: 钟离的失职令高义山大怒。

sentences.english: The official state media took Mr. Wen’s broadside as a pass to keep digging into Railways Ministry incompetence.
sentences.chinese: 官方国家媒体借此继续调查铁道部的失职。

sentences.english: He was reduced to ordinary soldier due to a serious dereliction of duty.
sentences.chinese: 他因严重失职被降为普通士兵。

sentences.english: Congress would be abdicating its responsibility if it gave the Treasury secretary a blank cheque.
sentences.chinese: 如果给财政部长开出“空白支票”，国会就是在失职。

sentences.english: The criminal ran away during escort, because the men in charge of escorting breached their duty.
sentences.chinese: 在监押途中犯人逃跑了，这是押解人员的失职。

sentences.english: How to Dissolve Labor Contracts on Grounds of Serious Dereliction of Duty or Practice of Graft?
sentences.chinese: 如何以劳动者严重失职或营私舞弊为由解除劳动合同？

sentences.english: It is the job of the intellectuals not that of the politicians.
sentences.chinese: 这是思想界的任务，却没有政治家的失职。

sentences.english: She could have filled her son's head with well-founded resentment for his absent father.
sentences.chinese: 她会让她的儿子头脑里充斥对他那个失职父亲的怨恨。

definition: breach of responsibility/failure to carry out one's duty
to fail in observing or supervising/to miss/to let sth slip through
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
not to do one's best/not to exert oneself
to abscond/to be absent without leave
cannot escape censure (idiom)/has to bear the blame
to avoid (esp. responsibility)/to shift (the blame)/to pass the buck
to cover up (a matter that should be reported to the authorities)
